results.title: Raiders of the top end
results.brief_description: A factual and exclusive account of the mainland activities of Exercise Kangaroo 89 which tested the ability of the Australian Defence Force to operate in and defend against terrorist style attack the vast, remote and sparsely populated region of Australia’s Top End. The program graphically captures the reality of how the threats and attacks by effective Kumarian enemy raiding parties were dealt with. It won a gold camera award and a certificate of creative excellence at the USA Film and Video Festival in Chicago 1990.

results.title: Raiders of the lost ark
results.creator_credit: Frank Marshall, Paramount Pictures, Lucasfilm, Ltd. and Steven Spielberg
results.brief_description: Harrison Ford immortalised the character of thrillseeker archaeologist Indiana Jones in this first of the series. From the opening sequence filled with huge crawling tarantulas, golden idols and giant rolling stones, “Raiders of the lost ark” is a rollercoaster of thrills and action. Jones is on a mission to find the missing Lost Ark of the Covenant and encounters evil Nazi’s, slithering snakes, mummified bodies and red tape before he achieves his mission. Co-starring Karen Allen and Denholm Elliott. A great movie from master blockbuster filmmakers George Lucas and Steven Spielberg.

results.title: Raging planet: earthquake: volcano
results.creator_credit: Richard Burke-Ward, David Hutt, Discovery Communications and Pioneer Productions
results.brief_description: Raging planet is a series which explores nature at its most hazardous and with the use of brilliant cinematography allows the viewer to be face to face with the violent forces of nature. This installment looks at the effect of earthquakes on California, Tokyo, South China and Mexico City, on buildings, livestock and humans. It also visits volcanoes that have created havoc in the world and talks briefly about predicting disasters and how they have proven true in the past. Originally screened on Discovery channel.

results.title: Raging bull [DVD]
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Irwin Winkler, Robert Chartoff and Martin Scorsese
results.brief_description: Film biography of New York boxer Jack La Motta, a one-time middleweight boxing champion who ended up an alcoholic running a sleazy Bronx nightclub. Traces Jake La Motta’s years of success in the forties to his humiliation in the fifties, ending with his career as a nightclub entertainer in 1964. This is not a conventional bio-pic with an explanatory approach to character. The exterior drama is displaced by La Motta’s struggle with interior demons. A radical awareness inflects the modes of the bio-pic and film noir, through the fractured structure, to link aggression with sexual repression and the denial of self with redemption. Robert De Niro gives an outstanding performance as the violent and inarticulate La Motta who pursues the “American Dream” the only way he knows how: through his fists. In “Raging bull” Scorsese continues his obsession with the dark side of the urban American psyche and the result is a largely pessimistic but passionate piece of filmmaking. The boxing sequences are operatic in their violent excess and not for weak stomachs. Despite numerous Oscar nominations (and a Best Actor win for De Niro) the film received a mixed critical reaction and performed poorly at the box-office. Currently however, “Raging bull” is considered a masterpiece of American cinema.

results.title: Rage
results.creator_credit: Fred Weintraub, Getty and Fromkess Pictures and George C. Scott
results.brief_description: Set in the peaceful farming landscape of Wyoming, and made at the height of the Vietnam War, “Rage” reflects the anger and suspicion that existed in the minds of many Americans towards their government and the military, particularly in regard to weapons testing and experimental research with chemical warfare. Dan Logan (George C.Scott) is a single father who lives with his son Chris (Nicolas Beauvy) on their sheep ranch in Wyoming. Life can be hard but the close bond between father and son is strong and the environment, although remote, is peaceful. But not for long. Whilst out on a camping trip, Dan’s world is shattered. The Logan ranch has been accidentally sprayed with a lethal dose of experimental nerve gas by an Army helicopter - Chris is in a coma, the sheep are dead, or dying, and Dan himself is dying. Seeking medical attention Dan finds instead that he is to be used as a guinea pig by the Army doctor, Major Holliford (Martin Sheen) to see what effects the nerve gas has on humans. Bitter, angry and frustrated by what appears to be a cover-up, and the eventual death of his son, Dan seeks revenge in the bloodiest and most brutal way possible. This is George C. Scott’s second directorial role (“The Anderson trial” (1970) television film being his first). The film includes a great support cast with Richard Basehart and Barnard Hughes. An appropriate film for the times.

results.title: Raft
results.brief_description: An account of an annual 1000km voyage by a family of four on a balsa raft down the Parnaiba River in Brazil. Their destination is a small town in Teresina, where their pottery, livestock and the raft will be sold. After the slow month long journey, the family is faced with the problem of the return trip. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Radioisotopes in industry
results.creator_credit: G. Buckland-Smith, U K Atomic Energy Authority, Film Producers Guild and W. B. Pollard
results.brief_description: Britain is the world’s largest exporter of radioactive isotopes. This film shows something of the theory and practice of manufacturing radioisotopes and some of their many industrial applications.

results.title: Radioisotope analytical techniques in mineral processing
results.creator_credit: Perier Films and Australian Atomic Energy Commission
results.brief_description: Shows use of radioisotopes in continuous on-stream analysis in mineral processing. Describes how the technique was developed by the Commission and its value in immediate and accurate detection of valuable elements. Suggests possible application in automatic control.

results.title: Radioactivity
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physics in action”.
Looks at the ionization of air, the diffusion cloud chamber, and radioactive decay and provides demonstrations to clarify the properties of radioactive particles not readily observed in laboratories. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
